channel.title: Vegetarian on Loving my tummy
channel.description: Recent content in Vegetarian on Loving my tummy

item.title: Austrian vanilla crescents
item.description: You can substitute almond flour for the ground walnuts. Cut butter into ½ inch cubes, then set aside in the freezer to keep cold. Meanwhile prepare the rest of the ingredients. Weigh the flour and set aside in the freezer or fridge as well. The colder the ingredients, the better. Grind walnuts very finely with a mouli grater (I couldn’t find walnut meal). Don’t use a food processor, the chopped pieces will still come out too big.

item.title: Carrot & Coconut cake
item.description: Grease a baking pan with a knob of butter and dust it with a bit of flour. Tap the pan to remove any excess flour. Using an electric mixer, beat the eggs with the sugar until well combined. Add the softened butter and continue mixing. Incorporate the shredded coconut and keep beating until everything is well blended. Peel and grate the carrots, then add them to the mixture, stirring with a spoon.

item.title: Cauliflower steaks with roasted red pepper & olive salsa
item.description: Unlock the flavours of cauliflower with a red pepper, olive and caper salsa, topped with almonds. Healthy and vegan, it makes a tasty light lunch or supper. Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7 and line a baking tray with baking parchment. Slice the cauliflower into two 1-inch steaks – use the middle part as it’s larger, and save the rest for another time. Rub the paprika and 1⁄2 tbsp oil over the steaks and season.

item.title: Chocolate palm heart
item.description: Mix the ground oats with the yogurt using a whisk or blender. Spread the mixture on parchment paper, shaping it into a hearth. Bake for 12 minutes at 180°C (356°F), flipping once halfway through. Melt the chocolate or cocoa powder and cover the pastry. Let it cool and then refrigerate in the fridge. From Instagram @fitfoodmania.

item.title: Esquites
item.description: Mix all the ingredients in a glass. From Tako Away.

item.title: Frittata (onion omelette)
item.description: Ingredients for 2 servings. Peel the onions and slice them thinly. In a large pan, add a drizzle of oil, then the onions, cook them for about 10 minutes over medium heat, stirring occasionally until they soften (the onions should be translucent). Beat the eggs in a bowl. Add the grated Parmesan, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of pepper, and mix well. When the onions are completely softened, spread them evenly across the bottom of the pan.

item.title: Griddled halloumi with watermelon & caper breadcrumbs
item.description: This salad has a great interplay of textures, temperatures and flavours. Toss juicy watermelon with salty cheese, crispy breadcrumbs, capers, almonds and mint. Cut the watermelon into either cubes or slices and transfer to a bowl with the very finely sliced shallots. Add 4 tbsp extra virgin olive oil and the balsamic, then season with fresh black pepper. Cover and put in the fridge for about 15-20 mins. Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan.

item.title: Lentils donettes
item.description: Quantities for 28 small donuts. Blend all the ingredients. Divide the mixture into a donut mold and bake at 180°C (350°F) for 18 minutes; or for 5 minutes in a donut maker. (Optional) Let cool and decorate with melted dark chocolate mixed with almond pieces. From Instagram @marisel.orozco.

item.title: Lime, physalis and elderflower caipiroska
item.description: Lime, Physalis and Elderflower Caipiroska Equipment 1 x Short Glass 1 x Crushed ice 1 x Jigger 1 x Muddler 1 x Chopping Board 1 x Knife Cut the lime in wedges, take out the white membrane, then cut the physalis in half and place in a glass. Muddle the lime, physalis with the Elderflower sugar syrup in the glass. With the muddler press down on the lime and physalis to extract flavor and juices.

item.title: Mushrooms in sauce with egg
item.description: Ingredients for 2 servings. Peel and chop the garlic cloves and sauté them in a pot with a drizzle of oil. Peel and chop the onion, add it to the pot, and let it soften. Season and add the dried chili peppers. Add the flour and cook it. Pour in the wine and add the cleaned and quartered mushrooms. Season and cook for 12-15 minutes. Remove the chili peppers and fill 2 oven-proof ramekins with the mushroom mixture.

item.title: No-Bake Cheesecake
item.description: Prepare the Base In a blender or food processor, break the cookies into small pieces and blend until finely crushed. Melt the butter and mix it with the crushed cookies. Stir until the mixture resembles wet sand. Line the base of a 20 cm (8-inch) springform pan with parchment paper to prevent sticking. Press the cookie and butter mixture firmly into the bottom of the pan using the back of a spoon to create a compact and even base.

item.title: Oat and Chocolate cookies
item.description: You can use wheat flour or any other kind of flour. I even recommend using ground oats as flour, in addition to the oat flakes. Preheat the oven with two baking trays lined with parchment paper. Mix the butter, sugar, and egg in a bowl. Add the remaining ingredients to the mixture except for the chocolate, and mix with a dough utensil until fully combined. Add the chopped chocolate and incorporate it evenly into the dough.

item.title: Spring bread
item.description: Toast the bread with the olive oil. Put the ingredients on top. To improve the receipt, you can use bread from pizza dough. You can also replace the tomato with cherry tomatoes. From Pizzeria Primavera.
